user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 is: The Standard Library function memcmp shall not be used to compare null terminated strings.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_socket_nonblocking_:
```c
int
MHD_socket_nonblocking_ (MHD_socket sock)
{
#if defined(MHD_POSIX_SOCKETS)
  int flags;

  flags = fcntl (sock,
                 F_GETFL);
  if (-1 == flags)
    return 0;

  if ( ((flags | O_NONBLOCK) != flags) &&
       (0 != fcntl (sock,
                    F_SETFL,
                    flags | O_NONBLOCK)) )
    return 0;
#elif defined(MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS)
  unsigned long flags = 1;

  if (0 != ioctlsocket (sock,
                        (int) FIONBIO,
                        &flags))
    return 0;
#endif /* MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS */
  return ! 0;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function MHD_socket_nonblocking_:
#define MHD_POSIX_SOCKETS 1
...
typedef int MHD_socket
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No occurrences of the Standard Library function memcmp are present in the provided code. The function MHD_socket_nonblocking_ only calls fcntl and ioctlsocket (depending on platform), manipulates integer flags, and returns an integer value. There are no string variables, no char* or null-terminated string operations, and no other standard library string/comparison functions used in this fragment. Therefore there are no code fragments here that could violate MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.14 (which specifically forbids using memcmp to compare null-terminated strings). If memcmp usage exists elsewhere in the project it is not in the submitted snippet and would need to be reviewed separately.
